conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the motion of the objects and the forces acting on them.
Object A (mass m = 1 kg) moves vertically.
Object B (mass m = 1 kg) moves along the inclined plane.
Acceleration due to gravity g = 10 m/s².

premise: Object A moves vertically down with force F_A = mg = 10 N.
conclusion: Force on object A is 10 N.

premise: Object B moves up the incline with force F_B = mg sin θ = 10 × sin 37° = 10 × 0.6 = 6 N.
conclusion: Force on object B is 6 N.

premise: Net force on the system F_net = F_A - F_B = 10 - 6 = 4 N.
conclusion: Net force on the system is 4 N.

premise: Total mass M = m_A + m_B = 2 kg.
conclusion: Total mass of the system is 2 kg.
Acceleration of the system is 2 m/s².

premise: Initial height h = 1 m, initial velocity u = 0, using v² = u² + 2as.
conclusion: Final velocity v = 2 m/s when object A hits the ground.
After the string breaks, object B moves up the incline with initial velocity v_0 = 2 m/s.

premise: Acceleration up the incline (deceleration due to gravity) a = -g sin θ = -6 m/s².
conclusion: Deceleration of object B is -6 m/s².

premise: Using v = v_0 + at, at maximum height v = 0.
conclusion: Time to reach maximum height t = 1/3 s.

premise: Using s = v_0 t + 1/2 a t², substitute values.
Acceleration down the incline a = g sin θ = 6 m/s².
conclusion: Acceleration of object B down the incline is 6 m/s².
